Label: Initial
Description: Reasoning capability exists but produces inconsistent, unreliable outputs; frequent errors and hallucinations
Capability Indicators: Occasional correct reasoning chains; high hallucination rate (>30%); inconsistent task decomposition; cannot reliably explain reasoning
Value Indicators: Minimal decision support value; human must verify all outputs; negative ROI due to correction overhead
Progression Criteria: Establish baseline accuracy metrics; implement basic chain-of-thought prompting; document failure patterns

Label: Developing
Description: Reasoning produces correct outputs in familiar contexts; struggles with novel or complex problems
Capability Indicators: Consistent reasoning on routine tasks; error rate 15-30%; task decomposition works for known patterns; basic explanations possible
Value Indicators: Emerging productivity gains on routine tasks; reduces human effort for simple analyses; positive ROI in narrow domains
Progression Criteria: Expand training/prompting for diverse problem types; implement self-consistency checks; establish reasoning benchmarks

Label: Defined
Description: Reasoning is standardized and reliable across defined problem domains; processes are documented and repeatable
Capability Indicators: Error rate <15%; multi-step reasoning reliable; handles moderate complexity; explanations are coherent and traceable
Value Indicators: Consistent decision quality improvement; measurable time savings; reliable task completion in defined scope
Progression Criteria: Implement systematic evaluation; add reflection mechanisms; measure reasoning quality metrics

Label: Managed
Description: Reasoning quality is measured, monitored, and optimized; quantitative performance targets are met
Capability Indicators: Error rate <5%; multi-path exploration with measured path quality; self-reflection catches most errors; reasoning adapts to feedback
Value Indicators: Significant decision quality gains (>25% improvement); quantified accuracy metrics; predictable performance
Progression Criteria: Implement continuous monitoring; optimize reasoning strategies based on data; add cross-validation mechanisms

Label: Optimizing
Description: Reasoning continuously improves through learning; achieves expert-level performance on complex, novel problems
Capability Indicators: Near-zero error rate on trained domains; successfully handles novel problems; reasoning quality improves over time; matches/exceeds human expert performance
Value Indicators: Transformative decision support; enables new capabilities previously requiring human experts; strategic competitive advantage
Progression Criteria: Focus on novel problem domains; implement continuous learning; benchmark against human experts

Label: Initial
Description: Tool integration exists but is fragile; frequent failures, incorrect parameter generation, inconsistent invocation
Capability Indicators: Tool calls fail >30% of time; incorrect parameter generation common; no error recovery; single tool only
Value Indicators: Minimal automation value; human intervention required for most tool operations; negative productivity impact
Progression Criteria: Implement tool documentation; establish invocation accuracy metrics; add basic error handling

Label: Developing
Description: Tool integration works reliably for specific, well-documented tools in controlled contexts
Capability Indicators: Tool success rate 70-85%; handles 2-3 well-known tools; basic parameter generation; limited error recovery
Value Indicators: Emerging automation value; reduces human effort for routine tool operations; positive ROI for specific workflows
Progression Criteria: Expand tool repertoire; implement multi-tool sequencing; add parameter validation

Label: Defined
Description: Tool integration is standardized across a defined tool set; orchestration follows documented patterns
Capability Indicators: Tool success rate >85%; reliable multi-tool orchestration; handles tool failures gracefully; documented integration patterns
Value Indicators: Consistent workflow automation; measurable productivity gains (20-40%); reliable tool-based task completion
Progression Criteria: Implement tool registry; add dynamic tool selection; establish orchestration metrics

Label: Managed
Description: Tool integration is measured, optimized, and adaptively managed; performance targets consistently met
Capability Indicators: Tool success rate >95%; optimal tool selection measured; adaptive orchestration based on context; enterprise API integration
Value Indicators: Significant automation value (40-60% productivity gains); quantified tool efficiency metrics; cross-system workflow automation
Progression Criteria: Implement adaptive tool selection; add enterprise integration patterns; optimize orchestration based on metrics

Label: Optimizing
Description: Tool integration continuously improves; discovers and adapts to new tools; achieves seamless ecosystem connectivity
Capability Indicators: Near-perfect tool success rate; autonomous tool discovery and integration; optimal orchestration continuously refined; full enterprise ecosystem connectivity
Value Indicators: Transformative process automation; enables new business capabilities; strategic platform value
Progression Criteria: Focus on autonomous tool discovery; implement continuous optimization; expand ecosystem connectivity

Label: Initial
Description: Memory exists but is unreliable; context frequently lost; inconsistent recall
Capability Indicators: Context lost within conversation; inconsistent recall of earlier turns; no cross-session memory; frequent contradictions
Value Indicators: Minimal continuity value; user must repeat context; frustrating experience; no personalization
Progression Criteria: Implement context management; establish recall accuracy metrics; add consistency checks

Label: Developing
Description: Memory maintains context within sessions; limited retention for extended interactions
Capability Indicators: Session coherence for 10-50 turns; some context retention; basic consistency within conversation; no cross-session learning
Value Indicators: Emerging productivity value; supports extended conversations; reduces context repetition
Progression Criteria: Extend context retention; implement memory summarization; add cross-session storage

Label: Defined
Description: Memory systematically maintains context across extended sessions; documented memory patterns
Capability Indicators: Session coherence for 100+ turns; cross-session recall for key information; documented memory architecture; episodic recall functional
Value Indicators: Consistent continuity value; effective personalization; measurable user satisfaction improvement
Progression Criteria: Implement memory consolidation; add semantic memory; establish long-term retention metrics

Label: Managed
Description: Memory is measured, optimized, and actively managed; retention quality targets consistently met
Capability Indicators: Cross-session recall >90% accuracy; memory consolidation optimized; multiple memory types coordinated; measured retention quality
Value Indicators: Significant personalization value; quantified user experience improvement; efficient long-horizon task support
Progression Criteria: Implement memory optimization; add procedural memory; optimize consolidation based on metrics

Label: Optimizing
Description: Memory continuously improves through use; achieves human-like retention and learning capabilities
Capability Indicators: Near-perfect long-term recall; autonomous memory organization; continuous skill accumulation; matches human memory patterns
Value Indicators: Transformative continuity; enables lifelong learning agents; strategic relationship value
Progression Criteria: Focus on continuous learning; implement autonomous organization; benchmark against human memory

Label: Initial
Description: Coordination exists but is chaotic; frequent miscommunication, duplicated effort, conflicts
Capability Indicators: Role assignments unclear; task handoffs fail >30% of time; no conflict resolution; duplicated or dropped work
Value Indicators: Minimal coordination value; worse than single-agent performance; coordination overhead exceeds benefits
Progression Criteria: Define basic roles; establish communication protocols; add handoff verification

Label: Developing
Description: Coordination works for simple, predefined scenarios; struggles with dynamic requirements
Capability Indicators: Basic role-based coordination; successful handoffs for known tasks; limited conflict handling; 2-3 agent coordination
Value Indicators: Emerging scale value; handles parallelizable tasks; modest throughput improvement
Progression Criteria: Expand coordination patterns; implement negotiation; add dynamic task allocation

Label: Defined
Description: Coordination is standardized with clear protocols; handles moderate complexity reliably
Capability Indicators: Documented coordination protocols; reliable role-based hierarchy; effective task allocation; 4-6 agent coordination
Value Indicators: Consistent scale value; measurable throughput improvement (50-100%); reliable multi-agent workflows
Progression Criteria: Implement peer collaboration; add voting/debate mechanisms; establish coordination metrics

Label: Managed
Description: Coordination is measured, optimized, and adaptively managed; performance targets met
Capability Indicators: Coordination efficiency measured; optimal agent allocation; peer collaboration with consensus; adaptive team formation
Value Indicators: Significant scale value (100-200% throughput); quantified coordination efficiency; complex multi-agent tasks
Progression Criteria: Implement adaptive coalition formation; optimize based on metrics; add emergent coordination patterns

Label: Optimizing
Description: Coordination continuously improves; achieves emergent collective intelligence exceeding sum of parts
Capability Indicators: Autonomous coalition formation; emergent communication protocols; continuous coordination optimization; collective intelligence demonstrated
Value Indicators: Transformative scale value; enables tasks impossible for single agents; strategic capability multiplication
Progression Criteria: Focus on emergent intelligence; implement continuous learning; benchmark against human teams

Label: Initial
Description: Autonomy exists but is unreliable; inappropriate decisions, boundary violations, unpredictable behavior
Capability Indicators: Autonomy boundaries unclear; frequent inappropriate autonomous actions; no escalation recognition; unpredictable goal pursuit
Value Indicators: Minimal autonomy value; requires constant supervision; risk exposure from unpredictable actions
Progression Criteria: Define autonomy boundaries; implement escalation triggers; establish behavior monitoring

Label: Developing
Description: Autonomy works within narrow, well-defined boundaries; requires significant oversight
Capability Indicators: Clear autonomy limits for specific tasks; appropriate escalation 70-85% of time; goal pursuit in defined scope; human checkpoints respected
Value Indicators: Emerging autonomy value; reduces human burden for routine decisions; positive ROI in bounded contexts
Progression Criteria: Expand autonomy scope incrementally; improve escalation accuracy; implement confidence thresholds

Label: Defined
Description: Autonomy is standardized with documented boundaries; consistent behavior within defined scope
Capability Indicators: Documented autonomy policies; appropriate escalation >90% of time; reliable goal decomposition; consistent boundary compliance
Value Indicators: Consistent autonomy value; measurable reduction in human oversight (40-60%); reliable independent operation
Progression Criteria: Implement adaptive autonomy; add exception handling; establish autonomy performance metrics

Label: Managed
Description: Autonomy is measured, optimized, and dynamically adjusted based on context and performance
Capability Indicators: Autonomy dynamically calibrated; escalation optimized based on risk; measured autonomy effectiveness; >95% appropriate behavior
Value Indicators: Significant autonomy value (60-80% oversight reduction); quantified risk-adjusted autonomy; predictable independent operation
Progression Criteria: Implement risk-based autonomy adjustment; optimize based on outcomes; add proactive capability

Label: Optimizing
Description: Autonomy continuously improves; achieves appropriate independent operation with minimal human involvement
Capability Indicators: Self-calibrating autonomy; proactive goal creation aligned with user needs; continuous improvement in autonomous judgment; near-human decision quality
Value Indicators: Transformative autonomy value; enables 24/7 operation; strategic capacity multiplication
Progression Criteria: Focus on proactive assistance; implement continuous learning; benchmark against human judgment

Label: Initial
Description: Adaptation exists but is ineffective; fails to learn from experience, repeats same errors
Capability Indicators: No measurable improvement from feedback; same errors repeated; no contextual adaptation; static behavior despite experience
Value Indicators: Minimal adaptation value; no learning curve benefits; user frustration from repeated failures
Progression Criteria: Implement feedback capture; establish learning metrics; add basic error tracking

Label: Developing
Description: Adaptation works for simple adjustments; in-context learning functional but limited
Capability Indicators: In-context adaptation for similar tasks; some improvement from examples; basic pattern recognition; limited generalization
Value Indicators: Emerging adaptation value; reduces explicit instruction needs; modest efficiency gains over time
Progression Criteria: Expand in-context learning; implement feedback-driven refinement; add transfer learning

Label: Defined
Description: Adaptation is systematic and reliable; documented learning patterns produce consistent improvement
Capability Indicators: Reliable in-context adaptation; verbal feedback integration; measurable improvement per interaction; documented adaptation patterns
Value Indicators: Consistent adaptation value; measurable learning curve (20-40% improvement over time); reduced training needs
Progression Criteria: Implement continuous feedback loops; add reflection-based learning; establish adaptation metrics

Label: Managed
Description: Adaptation is measured, optimized, and produces quantifiable performance improvements
Capability Indicators: Measured learning rate; optimized feedback integration; demonstrable skill acquisition; adaptation effectiveness tracked
Value Indicators: Significant adaptation value (40-60% improvement trajectory); quantified learning efficiency; predictable skill development
Progression Criteria: Implement fine-tuning pipelines; optimize learning rate; add continuous learning mechanisms

Label: Optimizing
Description: Adaptation continuously improves; achieves autonomous capability expansion and transfer
Capability Indicators: Self-directed learning; cross-domain transfer; continuous parameter improvement; autonomous skill library expansion
Value Indicators: Transformative adaptation value; enables capability growth without explicit training; strategic learning advantage
Progression Criteria: Focus on autonomous learning; implement transfer learning; benchmark against human learning

Label: Initial
Description: Collaboration exists but is frustrating; poor understanding, inappropriate responses, trust violations
Capability Indicators: Frequent misunderstandings; inappropriate response tone/content; no explanation capability; user trust consistently violated
Value Indicators: Minimal collaboration value; negative user experience; adoption resistance; trust deficit
Progression Criteria: Implement understanding verification; add basic explanation; establish user satisfaction metrics

Label: Developing
Description: Collaboration works for simple query-response; struggles with complex or sensitive interactions
Capability Indicators: Basic dialogue coherent; simple explanations possible; appropriate tone in standard contexts; trust maintained for routine tasks
Value Indicators: Emerging collaboration value; acceptable user experience for simple tasks; positive adoption for specific uses
Progression Criteria: Expand dialogue capabilities; implement introspective explanation; add trust calibration

Label: Defined
Description: Collaboration is standardized with consistent interaction quality; explanations enable oversight
Capability Indicators: Reliable dialogue across contexts; clear explanations of reasoning; appropriate trust signals; documented interaction patterns
Value Indicators: Consistent collaboration value; measurable user satisfaction (>70%); effective oversight enablement
Progression Criteria: Implement bidirectional feedback; add shared context building; establish collaboration metrics

Label: Managed
Description: Collaboration is measured, optimized, and adapts to individual user needs; trust appropriately calibrated
Capability Indicators: Measured collaboration effectiveness; personalized interaction style; trust calibration accurate; proactive explanation when needed
Value Indicators: Significant collaboration value (>85% satisfaction); quantified trust calibration; optimized human-AI teaming
Progression Criteria: Implement adaptive interaction; optimize based on user feedback; add shared mental models

Label: Optimizing
Description: Collaboration continuously improves; achieves true partnership with shared mental models and mutual transparency
Capability Indicators: Continuous collaboration improvement; bidirectional transparency; shared mental models; graceful handoff perfected; partnership experience
Value Indicators: Transformative collaboration value; synergistic human-AI performance; strategic teaming advantage
Progression Criteria: Focus on mutual understanding; implement continuous refinement; benchmark against human teams

Label: Initial
Description: Compliance exists on paper but is inconsistent; frequent policy violations, no accountability
Capability Indicators: Policy violations >10% of interactions; no audit trail; inconsistent access control; alignment drift undetected
Value Indicators: Minimal compliance value; regulatory risk exposure; potential liability; enterprise deployment blocked
Progression Criteria: Implement basic policy encoding; add audit logging; establish violation metrics

Label: Developing
Description: Compliance works for basic policies; struggles with complex regulatory requirements
Capability Indicators: Policy compliance >90% for basic rules; basic audit trail; access control functional but incomplete; alignment maintained for simple scenarios
Value Indicators: Emerging compliance value; acceptable for low-risk applications; basic regulatory satisfaction
Progression Criteria: Expand policy coverage; implement comprehensive audit; add alignment monitoring

Label: Defined
Description: Compliance is systematized with documented policies; consistent adherence across defined scope
Capability Indicators: Policy compliance >95%; comprehensive audit trail; role-based access enforced; documented compliance procedures
Value Indicators: Consistent compliance value; measurable regulatory adherence; enterprise deployment enabled for defined scope
Progression Criteria: Implement compliance automation; add regulatory mapping; establish compliance metrics

Label: Managed
Description: Compliance is measured, monitored, and proactively managed; quantitative compliance targets met
Capability Indicators: Policy compliance >99%; proactive compliance monitoring; automated regulatory reporting; alignment continuously verified
Value Indicators: Significant compliance value; quantified regulatory adherence; audit-ready at all times; reduced compliance overhead
Progression Criteria: Implement predictive compliance; optimize based on metrics; add continuous alignment verification

Label: Optimizing
Description: Compliance continuously improves; achieves sustained value alignment through ongoing governance
Capability Indicators: Near-perfect compliance; self-correcting alignment; continuous governance improvement; regulatory change adaptation
Value Indicators: Transformative compliance value; enables high-stakes enterprise deployment; strategic trust advantage
Progression Criteria: Focus on sustained alignment; implement adaptive governance; benchmark against regulatory best practices

Label: Initial
Description: Safety exists minimally; frequent harmful outputs, vulnerable to attacks, poor failure handling
Capability Indicators: Harmful output rate >5%; adversarial attacks succeed >50%; no graceful degradation; safety incidents common
Value Indicators: Minimal safety value; liability exposure; reputational risk; production deployment blocked
Progression Criteria: Implement basic guardrails; add input validation; establish safety incident metrics

Label: Developing
Description: Safety works for common cases; struggles with sophisticated attacks or edge cases
Capability Indicators: Harmful output rate 1-5%; basic attack detection; limited robustness; some graceful degradation
Value Indicators: Emerging safety value; acceptable for low-risk applications; basic liability protection
Progression Criteria: Expand guardrail coverage; implement robustness testing; add failure recovery

Label: Defined
Description: Safety is systematized with documented mechanisms; consistent protection across defined threats
Capability Indicators: Harmful output rate <1%; robustness tested against known attacks; documented safety architecture; reliable graceful degradation
Value Indicators: Consistent safety value; measurable harm prevention; enterprise deployment enabled; insurable
Progression Criteria: Implement continuous monitoring; add interruptibility; establish safety performance metrics

Label: Managed
Description: Safety is measured, monitored, and proactively managed; quantitative safety targets met
Capability Indicators: Harmful output rate <0.1%; proactive threat detection; measured safety effectiveness; rapid incident response
Value Indicators: Significant safety value; quantified harm prevention; audit-ready safety documentation; reduced liability exposure
Progression Criteria: Implement predictive safety; optimize based on metrics; add defense-in-depth layers

Label: Optimizing
Description: Safety continuously improves; achieves comprehensive protection with minimal false positives
Capability Indicators: Near-zero harmful outputs; adaptive threat response; continuous safety improvement; minimal operational friction
Value Indicators: Transformative safety value; enables high-capability deployment; strategic trust advantage
Progression Criteria: Focus on adaptive protection; implement continuous learning; benchmark against safety best practices
